conclusion: Determine the direction of the light ray when it first exits the prism by following the path of the light through each interface and applying Snell's Law.
Given: AB = BC = 8 cm, OA = 2 cm, ∠OAB = 60°.
Equation of line AB is y = √3(x - 2).
Angle of incidence at point E is 60°.
Using Snell's Law at point E, r = sin⁻¹(√6/4) ≈ 40.89°.
Light ray travels inside the prism and strikes face BC at point F with angle of incidence 45°.
Light undergoes total internal reflection at point F.
Reflected angle is 45°, light ray strikes face CD at point G with angle of incidence 45°.
Using Snell's Law at point G, γ' = 90°.
Light ray exits perpendicular to face CD.
The direction of the light ray when it first exits the prism is 90°.
